title: Virgil van Dijk rates Mohamed Salah's chances of facing Man Utd
text:
Mohamed Salah was forced off with an ankle injury in Liverpool’s win over Leicester (Picture: Getty)

Liverpool star Virgil van Dijk is confident Mohamed Salah will return from his ankle injury in time to face Manchester United after the international break.

Hamza Choudhury was widely condemned for his challenge on Salah in Leicester’s 2-1 defeat to Liverpool at the weekend, with the Egyptian forward having to be replaced by Adam Lallana in the 89th minute.

Though referee Chris Kavanagh booked Choudhury, Jurgen Klopp felt the ‘dangerous as hell’ tackle was deserving of a red card.

Fortunately for Liverpool, it appears Salah avoided serious injury and Van Dijk believes his team-mate will make a speedy recovery and be available to take on United at Old Trafford on October 20.

Liverpool are hopeful Salah will make a speedy recovery (Picture: Getty)

‘I think he should be not too bad,’ the Liverpool central defender told Sky Sports.

‘The good thing he has plenty of time to recover.

‘He’ll probably get a time to recover as well.

‘So I’m not concerned that he’s not going to be ready for United away.’

On Choudhury’s challenge, Klopp said: ‘I don’t understand how he can do it because the ball is far away.

‘If you bring down a player in full sprint, when the ball is not around, it is for me only one colour. It’s dangerous as hell.

‘I don’t want to cause the boy any problems but he has to calm down.

‘He is a super player, super development in the last two years. But these kind of challenges? No.

‘If you are quick someone needs to make sure that not everything is allowed to bring you down. The ball is not even close.

‘I don’t need to be a football manager to know this can cause serious injury. I only need two eyes.’
